parkingRobot

Interface IPerception

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PerceptionPMP

    public interface IPerception
    interface for the main module 'Perception', providing methods for getting all measuring data from the robot sensors
    Author:
    PMP

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPerception.AngleDifferenceMeasurement
      bundles both values relevant for measuring an angle difference by an encoder sensor
      static class  IPerception.EncoderSensor
      supports processing of encoder sensor by recording the angle difference since last call of getEncoderMeasurement and the corresponding time interval.
      static class  IPerception.OdoDifferenceMeasurement
      bundles all values relevant for measuring an shift difference by an Odometry sensor
      static class  IPerception.OdoSensor
      supports processing of the Mouse-odometrysensor by recording the Shift in U-and V-direction since last call of getOdoMeasurement and the corresponding time interval.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calibrateLineSensors()
      calibrate the two LineSensors use a black and white floor color
      double getBackSensorDistance()
      returns the Distance of the back Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the third Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
      double getBackSideSensorDistance()
      returns the Distance of the back-side Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the fourth Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
      IPerception.EncoderSensor getControlLeftEncoder()
      returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the left encoder for the Control-Module
      IPerception.OdoSensor getControlOdo()
      returns the Object of the IPerception.OdoSensor class for the Control Module
      IPerception.EncoderSensor getControlRightEncoder()
      returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the right encoder for the Control-Module
      double getFrontSensorDistance()
      returns the Distance of the front Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the first Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
      double getFrontSideSensorDistance()
      returns the Distance of the front-side Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the second Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
      int getLeftLineSensor()
      returns the groundcolortype of the left linesensor use calibrateLineSensors() to calibrate the sensors for given environmental brightness
      int getLeftLineSensorValue()
      returns the brightness of the subsurfacecolor under the left linesensor in percent (0% for calibrated black ground; 100% for calibrated white ground).
      IPerception.EncoderSensor getNavigationLeftEncoder()
      returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the left encoder for the Navigation-Module
      IPerception.OdoSensor getNavigationOdo()
      returns the Object of the IPerception.OdoSensor class for the Navigation Module
      IPerception.EncoderSensor getNavigationRightEncoder()
      returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the right encoder for the Navigation-Module
      int getOdometryT()
      returns the timedifference between the last 2 Odometrymeasurements in ms
      int getRightLineSensor()
      returns the groundcolortype of the right linesensor use calibrateLineSensors() to calibrate the sensors for given environmental brightness
      int getRightLineSensorValue()
      returns the brightness of the subsurfacecolor under the right linesensor in percent (0% for calibrated black ground; 100% for calibrated white ground).
      double getUOdmometryDiffernce()
      returns the latest measured shift in U-direction of the robot in mm.
      double getVOdometryDifference()
      returns the latest measured shift in V-direction of the robot in mm.
      void showSensorData()
      Displays all sensor data from the Arduino on the LCD-Display
      void updateSensors()
      method for updating all the Sensorvalues by default automatically called by perceptionThread

    • Method Detail

      • calibrateLineSensors

        void calibrateLineSensors()
        calibrate the two LineSensors use a black and white floor color

      • getBackSensorDistance

        double getBackSensorDistance()
        returns the Distance of the back Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the third Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
        Returns:
        Distance in mm from back sensor

      • getBackSideSensorDistance

        double getBackSideSensorDistance()
        returns the Distance of the back-side Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the fourth Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
        Returns:
        Distance in mm from back-side sensor

      • getControlLeftEncoder

        IPerception.EncoderSensor getControlLeftEncoder()
        returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the left encoder for the Control-Module
        Returns:
        the left Encodersensor for the ControlRST-Class

      • getControlOdo

        IPerception.OdoSensor getControlOdo()
        returns the Object of the IPerception.OdoSensor class for the Control Module
        Returns:
        OdoSensor for the ControlRST-Class

      • getControlRightEncoder

        IPerception.EncoderSensor getControlRightEncoder()
        returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the right encoder for the Control-Module
        Returns:
        the right Encodersensor for the ControlRST-Module

      • getFrontSensorDistance

        double getFrontSensorDistance()
        returns the Distance of the front Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the first Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
        Returns:
        Distance in mm from front sensor

      • getFrontSideSensorDistance

        double getFrontSideSensorDistance()
        returns the Distance of the front-side Sensor to the next obstacle the Value commes from the second Tri-Sensor connected to the Arduino (the order of the Sensorports is set in the Arduino-code)
        Returns:
        Distance in mm from front-side sensor

      • getLeftLineSensor

        int getLeftLineSensor()
        returns the groundcolortype of the left linesensor use calibrateLineSensors() to calibrate the sensors for given environmental brightness
        Returns:
        groundtype (0-white ground, 1-grey ground, 2-black ground)

      • getLeftLineSensorValue

        int getLeftLineSensorValue()
        returns the brightness of the subsurfacecolor under the left linesensor in percent (0% for calibrated black ground; 100% for calibrated white ground). use calibrateLineSensors() to calibrate the sensors for given environmental brightness
        Returns:
        brightness of the groundcolor in percent(%)

      • getNavigationLeftEncoder

        IPerception.EncoderSensor getNavigationLeftEncoder()
        returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the left encoder for the Navigation-Module
        Returns:
        the left Encodersensor for the Navigation-Module

      • getNavigationOdo

        IPerception.OdoSensor getNavigationOdo()
        returns the Object of the IPerception.OdoSensor class for the Navigation Module
        Returns:
        OdoSensor for the NavigationAT-Class

      • getNavigationRightEncoder

        IPerception.EncoderSensor getNavigationRightEncoder()
        returns the IPerception.EncoderSensor Object of the right encoder for the Navigation-Module
        Returns:
        the right Encodersensor for the Navigation-Module

      • getOdometryT

        int getOdometryT()
        returns the timedifference between the last 2 Odometrymeasurements in ms
        Returns:
        T time between the last 2 Odometryvalues in ms

      • getRightLineSensor

        int getRightLineSensor()
        returns the groundcolortype of the right linesensor use calibrateLineSensors() to calibrate the sensors for given environmental brightness
        Returns:
        groundtype (0-white ground, 1-grey ground, 2-black ground)

      • getRightLineSensorValue

        int getRightLineSensorValue()
        returns the brightness of the subsurfacecolor under the right linesensor in percent (0% for calibrated black ground; 100% for calibrated white ground). use calibrateLineSensors() to calibrate the sensors for given environmental brightness
        Returns:
        brightness of the groundcolor in percent(%)

      • getUOdmometryDiffernce

        double getUOdmometryDiffernce()
        returns the latest measured shift in U-direction of the robot in mm. the related timedifference between the last 2 measurements returns getOdometryT()
        Returns:
        U difference in mm

      • getVOdometryDifference

        double getVOdometryDifference()
        returns the latest measured shift in V-direction of the robot in mm. the related timedifference between the last 2 measurements returns getOdometryT()
        Returns:
        V difference in mm

      • showSensorData

        void showSensorData()
        Displays all sensor data from the Arduino on the LCD-Display

      • updateSensors

        void updateSensors()
        method for updating all the Sensorvalues by default automatically called by perceptionThread
